newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: MAS says sells two aircraft in 1996/97.
newsitem.headline: MAS says sells two aircraft in 1996/97.

text.p: Malaysia Airline System Bhd (MAS) said on Thursday it sold two aircraft in the 1996/97 financial year.
In a statement accompanying its results, the national carrier said the two B-737-400 aircraft were sold for a gain of 43.8 million ringgit.
The company said the results were affected by higher fuel prices and the outbreak of cholera in northern Penang state.
"The results would have been better if not for higher fuel prices and the outbreak of cholera in Penang resulting in passenger cancellation," the statement said.
It said yields remained under pressure due to excess capacity and keen competition.
The airline was positive on its move to the new international airport in Sepang.
The move "will provide with greater opportunities for expansion of the company's operations", MAS said.
